image.altText: A close up of a silver pipe bomb

props.synopsis: Eleven explosive devices have been found next to footpaths in the city's north-west in the past two days, ACT police say.

title.children: Police say 11 explosive devices found on Canberra streets

image.altText: A colourful children's toy block lies sideways in front of a colourful abacus.

props.synopsis: Never-before-seen documents reveal reports of sexual abuse, inappropriate educator discipline, and children missing from ACT childcare centres.

title.children: Thousands of documents show behind the scenes of embattled childcare industry

image.altText: A yellow and purple car impounded by police.

props.synopsis: A major police operation at Summernats has resulted in 19 vehicle seizures, hundreds of traffic offences and multiple arrests.

title.children: Police seize 19 vehicles after dangerous driving at Summernats

image.altText: The exteior of a modern apartment block.

props.synopsis: Large glazed windows are a popular design flaw in Australian apartments, according to an expert.

title.children: Why apartments with floor-to-ceiling windows are a 'trade-off' in Australia

image.altText: Woman with bob haircut sits on a purple chair in an empty doctor waiting room.

props.synopsis: The percentage of GP clinics fully bulk-billing has almost doubled, according to a new report, however, the government says the data cannot be relied on.

title.children: Only 1 in 10 ACT GP clinics are bulk billing despite nationwide increase

image.altText: Generic NSW Police blue and white tape

props.synopsis: A 25-year-old man has died after a crash between a car and a truck on the Monaro Highway, south of Canberra.

title.children: ACT records first road fatality of 2026 after crash near Royalla

image.altText: A motion-sensor camera image of a koala.

props.synopsis: A motion-sensor camera has captured the rare sight of a koala in the wild at a wildlife sanctuary in Googong near the ACT border.

title.children: Camera footage 'giving us hope that koalas might still be around'

image.altText: An image of South Australia Premier Peter Malinauskas speaking.

props.synopsis: After backing the Adelaide Festival’s decision to drop a Palestinian Australian author from Writers’ Week, Premier Peter Malinauskas is now trying to get clear of a crisis that threatens to do untold damage to South Australia’s festival reputation.

title.children: SA premier attempts to distance himself from crisis engulfing the 'festival state'

image.altText: A close up of a silver pipe bomb

props.synopsis: Eleven explosive devices have been found next to footpaths in the city's north-west in the past two days, ACT police say.

title.children: Police say 11 explosive devices found on Canberra streets

image.altText: A dark-haired, middle-aged man speaks and points a finger.

props.synopsis: The US State Department will suspend processing of immigrant visas for people from 75 countries, including Fiji, Cambodia, Thailand, Somalia and Brazil, from January 21.

title.children: US to suspend immigrant visa processing for 75 countries

image.altText: A Palestinian woman wearing a long purple tunic, hijab, holds a toddler in her arms, in front of a mound of rubble.

props.synopsis: With little fanfare, the White House has announced "phase two" of the Gaza ceasefire has begun — at least, in terms of how it views the situation with the war-ravaged territory.

title.children: US announces second phase of Gaza ceasefire plan

image.altText: The Washington Post logo on a marble sign out the front of an office building.

props.synopsis: The reporter had previously reported on the Trump administration's efforts to fire hundreds of thousands of federal workers.

title.children: FBI raids home and seizes phone of Washington Post journalist

image.altText: Three people in shorts sitting on a deck sunbathing.

props.synopsis: From 6,000 applications each year, only about 300 make the cut to travel down to Antarctica and experience a workplace like no other.

title.children: Life at Casey Station: Inside Australia's Antarctic mission

image.altText: A storm cloud over the outback

props.synopsis: Severe thunderstorms and flooding rain are expected to ease the short-term fire threat, while Queensland continues to be drenched from ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji.

title.children: Best rain in months brings flood threat to eastern and northern Australia

image.altText: The exteior of a modern apartment block.

props.synopsis: Large glazed windows are a popular design flaw in Australian apartments, according to an expert.

title.children: Why apartments with floor-to-ceiling windows are a 'trade-off' in Australia

image.altText: Daniel Sanders goes over a sand dune on his motorbike during the Dakar Rally.

props.synopsis: Daniel Sanders says he has broken his collarbone and sternum in a crash on stage 10 of the Dakar Rally, but vows to finish the last three stages.

title.children: Australian champ vows to finish Dakar with broken collarbone, sternum

image.altText: woman's hand hold a little boys hand, deidentified

props.synopsis: Families who turned to social media to find an au pair say the lack of safeguards left them vulnerable to serious problems.

title.children: Families warn of risks after hiring au pairs through social media

image.altText: A limestone bridge structure with two arches carved by sea

props.synopsis: Kelli Bryers wasn't sure if anyone had seen the London Bridge rock formation collapse just seconds after she and her cousin, David Darrington, had crossed it.

title.children: 'No joke, London Bridge has fallen down': Trapped on a crumbling Apostle

image.altText: Woman wearing a suit holding her hands out

props.synopsis: Liberals are backing away from a push to tackle antisemitism with stronger racial hatred laws, with some senior figures in the party also voicing freedom of speech concerns.

title.children: Ley signals Liberals won't back 'unsalvageable' hate crime, gun control reforms

image.altText: a graphic of a computer aith an ai-generated woman on the screen

props.synopsis: Australia's peak union body moves to shore up creative and media jobs, while the ASX is set to rise marginally after Wall Street slides again. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ACTU signs AI deal with Microsoft to protect workers' rights

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 'Lab grown' chocolate on the table as cocoa prices rise
Oil prices drop as Trump says killings in Iran 'stopping'
ACTU signs AI deal with Microsoft

image.altText: A man with grey hair and sunglasses looks at the camera

props.synopsis: Would you face prison for what you believe in? Iranian filmmaker Jafar Panahi already has and, following the release of his latest film, he may again.

title.children: Why Iran's government doesn't want you to see this film

image.altText: Firefighters battling the Ravenswood fire in Moyreisk last week.

props.synopsis: More than 228 homes have been confirmed destroyed and 20,000 head of livestock killed by bushfires across Victoria, with authorities warning the total is likely to rise.

title.children: Tens of thousands of stock dead as Victorian bushfire assessments continue

image.altText: Flames and thick smoke can be seen on the horizon, with blackened crop in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Having repeatedly lost mobile coverage during recent bushfires, local councils and volunteer brigades are paying for expensive satellite units to maintain critical communications.

title.children: Costly Starlink units adding to financial pressure on volunteer fire brigades

image.altText: Doctor Luke Talbot sitting at a desk

props.synopsis: The town of Gulgong went 18 months without an open GP clinic. That's now changed, meaning residents no longer need to travel hundreds of kilometres to see a doctor.

title.children: Community secures first GPs in 18 months thanks to 'concierge' service

image.altText: A tall tree without any leaves in a mined sand pit.

props.synopsis: WA's environmental regulator is investigating an alleged breach of Alcoa's state-imposed mining conditions which, if proven, would make it illegal for the company to continue some of its mining operations.

title.children: Satellite pics show lone tree at centre of probe into Alcoa's WA operations

image.altText: Brisbane Heat player Marnus Labuschagne throws the ball while fielding in a Big Bash League game.

props.synopsis: A spectacular bowling effort in the final overs and a key contribution from Marnus Labuschagne help the Brisbane Heat to an upset win over the Hobart Hurricanes to keep their BBL finals hopes alive.

title.children: 'Annoying' Marnus key to Heat's stunning BBL win over Hurricanes

image.altText: A man in purple t shirt holding a ladder

props.synopsis: Thousands of people present to Australian hospitals each year for ladder and roof falls, with doctors urging caution — particularly for ageing Australians.

title.children: Why climbing ladders can have serious consequences for older Australians

image.altText: A close-up of feet walking on a footpath.

props.synopsis: Two new studies have found that small improvements in day-to-day life can have substantial impacts on life expectancy.

title.children: Even small boosts to sleep, exercise and veggie intake may help you live longer

image.altText: A vet with long blonde hair tied back wearing blue scrubs holds a ginger cat

props.synopsis: More than 250,000 people do not have ready access to a vet in Australia, and according to the industry it is not completely down to a shortage. It is also a distribution issue which is also putting biosecurity at risk.

title.children: In vet care deserts, an hour can be difference between life and death

image.altText: A red header harvests grain.

props.synopsis: New techniques and technology are allowing southern NSW grain growers to produce a harvest, despite significantly below-average rainfall.

title.children: Grain growers use new techniques to make every raindrop count

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman sitting on a chair, gray shoulder lengthy wavy hair, serious expression, blue top with lace on it.

props.synopsis: Despite the NT government signing on to establish 20 Aboriginal Law and Justice Groups by 2027, just five are up and running with less than 12 months to go.

title.children: Majority of NT Aboriginal justice groups yet to emerge as deadline looms

image.altText: A black and white image shows the Grok image logo which says 'Grok' next to a stylised black box

props.synopsis: New laws in the UK that would outlaw the generation of sexual deepfakes are set to come into force this week.

title.children: X to change AI chatbot after outrage over sexual deepfake images

image.altText: A woman sitting inside an official building looks on.

props.synopsis: Anti-corruption watchdogs in Ukraine have searched the offices of the country's former prime minister Yulia Tymoshenko amid allegations of a major bribery scheme.

title.children: Ukraine's former PM Yulia Tymoshenko facing allegations of bribery

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt smiles widely holding a silver trophy

props.synopsis: Sydneysider Jordan Smith has beaten grand slam champion Jannik Sinner and dual grand slam finalist Amanda Anasimova to take home the prize in the novelty format.

title.children: 'Can't speak': Tennis battler beats the pros to take home $1 million jackpot
